elements.description:
`api-navigation`
A navigation for an API spec using AMF model.

This element is to replace deprecated `raml-path-selector`.
It is lightweight and much less complex in comparision.

The element works with [AMF](https://github.com/mulesoft/amf)
json/ld model. When the model is set it computes list of documentation
nodes, types, endpoints, mathods and security schemas.
As a result user can select any of the items in the UI and the application
is informed about user choice via custom event.

The selection is a selected API shape `@id`. The application is responsible
for computing the model selected by the user.

AMF model can be passed directly by setting `amfModel` property or by
setting `aware` property and by use `raml-aware` element. It allows
to communicate AMF data without having access to the element due to
shadow DOM restrictions.

```html
<raml-aware scope="api-console"></raml-aware>
<api-navigation aware="api-console"></api-navigation>
```

Once the `raml-aware` element receives some that they are instantly
transfered to `api-navigation`.

Note, this element does not contain polyfills for Array platform features.
Use `arc-polyfills` to add support for IE and Safari 9.

## Passive navigation

Passive navigation means that a navigation event occured but it wasn't
invoked by intentional user interaction. For example
`api-endpoint-documentation` component renders list of documentations for
HTTP methods. While scrolling through the list navigation context
changes (user reads documentation of a method) but the navigation never
was caused by user intentional interaction.
This event, annotated with `passive: true` property in the detail object
prohibits other element from taking a navigation action but some
may reflect the change in the UI.

## Styling

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--api-navigation` | Mixin applied to this element | `{}`
`--arc-font-common-base` | Mixin applied to section headers. Theme mixin | `{}`
`--arc-font-font1` | Mixin applied to the element. Theme mixin | `{}`
`--api-navigation-header-color` | Color of section title | `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.84)`
`--api-navigation-section-title-background-color` | Background color of the section title | `inherit`
`--api-navigation-list-item-min-height` | Minimum heigtht of menu items. Note that each item has top and bottom padding set to 4px which cobines to default 48px. | `40px`
`--api-navigation-list-item-color` | Color of the menu items | `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.84)`
`--api-navigation-list-item` | Mixin applied to the menu items | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-selected-weight` | Font weight of selected menu item | `bold`
`--api-navigation-list-item-selected-background-color` | Background color of selected menu item | `--accent-color`
`--api-navigation-list-item-selected-color` | Color of selected menu item | `#fff`
`--api-navigation-list-item-selected` | Mixin applied to the selected item | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-disabled-color` | Color of disabled menu item. Currently not in use. | `--disabled-text-color`
`--api-navigation-list-item-disabled` | Mixin applied to disabled menu item. Currently not in use. | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-focused` |  Mixin applied to focused menu item. | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-focused-before` | Mixin applied to the `:before` pseudo-element of focused item | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-hovered` | Mixin applied to menu item when hovering and not focused. Note, you should not rely of hover states | `{}`
`--api-navigation-toggle-icon-color` | Color of the toggle button next to section title | `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.74)`
`--api-navigation-toggle-icon-hover-color` | Color of the toggle button next to section title when hovering. | `--secondary-button-color` or `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.88)`
`--api-navigation-endpoint-toggle-icon-color` | Colot of endpoint toggle button | `--api-navigation-toggle-icon-color` or `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.74)`
`--api-navigation-endpoint-toggle-icon` | Mixin applied to endpoint toggle icon | `{}`
`--method-display-get-color` | Font color of the GET method label box | `rgb(0, 128, 0)`
`--method-display-post-color` | Font color of the POST method label box | `rgb(33, 150, 243)`
`--method-display-put-color` | Font color of the PUT method label box | `rgb(255, 165, 0)`
`--method-display-delete-color` | Font color of the DELETE method label box | `rgb(244, 67, 54)`
`--method-display-patch-color` | Font color of the PATCH method label box | `rgb(156, 39, 176)`
`--api-navigation-operation-item-padding-left` | Padding left of operation (method) label under endpoint | `20px`
`--api-navigation-operation-collapse` | Mixin applied to operation list collapsable element | ``
`--api-navigation-list-section-font-size` | Font size of toggable section label | `16px`
`--api-navigation-endpoint-font-size` | Font size applied to endpoint label | `15px`
`--api-navigation-operation-font-size` | Font size of operation (HTTP method) label | `14px`
`--api-navigation-summary-label` | Mixin applied top the summary label | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-padding` | Padding of list a item | `4px 16px`
`--api-navigation-toggle-icon` | Mixin applied to toggle icon | `{}`
`--api-navigation-list-item-selected-passive` | Mixin applied to an item selected via "passive" navigation event" | `{}`
`--api-navigation-method-label-color` | Color of the HTTP method label | `#000`
`--api-navigation-method-label-background-color` | Background color of the HTTP method label | `transparent`
`--api-navigation-method-label-border-radius` | Border radius of HTTP method label | `3px`
`--method-display-font-weigth` | Font weight of HTTP label | `400`
`--method-label-VERB-background-color` | Background color of HTTP method label. Possible verbs are: `get`, `post`, `put`, `delete`, `patch` | `vary`
`--method-label-VERB-color` | Color of HTTP method label. Possible verbs are: `get`, `post`, `put`, `delete`, `patch` | `vary`
`--api-navigation-operation-endpoint-opened-background-color` | Background color of opened methods list | `inherit`
`--api-navigation-path-label-font-size` | Path label font size | `13px`
`--api-navigation-path-label-color` | Path label font color | `#616161`

properties.name: amfModel
properties.description:
Generated AMF json/ld model form the API spec.
The element assumes the object of the first array item to be a
type of `"http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document`
on AMF vocabulary.

It is only usefult for the element to resolve references.

properties.name: ns
properties.description: A namespace for AMF model

properties.name: aware
properties.description: `raml-aware` scope property to use.

properties.name: selected
properties.description:
A model `@id` of selected documentation part.
Special case is for `summary` view. It's not part of an API
but most applications has some kins of summary view for the
API.

properties.name: selectedType
properties.description:
Type of the selected item.
One of `documentation`, `type`, `security`, `endpoint`, `method`
or `summary`.

This property is set after `selected` property.

properties.name: summary
properties.description:
If set it renders `API summary` menu option.
It will allow to set `selected` and `selectedType` to `summary`
when this option is set.

properties.name: summaryLabel
properties.description: A label for the `summary` section.

properties.name: docs
properties.description: Computed list of documentatoin items in the API.

properties.name: hasDocs
properties.description: Computed value, true when `docs` property is set with values

properties.name: docsOpened
properties.description: Determines and changes state of documentation panel.

properties.name: types
properties.description: Computed list of "type" items in the API.

properties.name: hasTypes
properties.description: Computed value, true when `types` property is set with values

properties.name: typesOpened
properties.description: Determines and changes state of types panel.

properties.name: security
properties.description: Computed list of Security schemes items in the API.

properties.name: hasSecurity
properties.description: Computed value, true when `security` property is set with values

properties.name: securityOpened
properties.description: Determines and changes state of security panel.

properties.name: endpoints
properties.description: Computed list of endpoint items in the API.

properties.name: hasEndpoints
properties.description: Computed value, true when `endpoints` property is set with values

properties.name: endpointsOpened
properties.description: Determines and changes state of endpoints panel.

properties.name: noink
properties.description: If true, the element will not produce a ripple effect when interacted with via the pointer.

properties.name: query
properties.description:
Filters list elements by this value when set.
Clear the value to reset the search.

This is not currently exposed in element's UI due
to complexity of search and performance.

properties.name: indentSize
properties.description:
Size of endpoint indentation for nested resources.
In pixels.

properties.name: _isFragment
properties.description: Flag set when passed AMF model is a RAML fragment.

properties.name: _renderSummary
properties.description:
Computed value. True when summary should be rendered.
Summary should be rendered only when `summary` is set and
current model is not a RAML fragment.

properties.name: allowPaths
properties.description:
When set it renders full path below endpoint name if the endpoint has
a name (different than the path).
This is not always recommended to use this option as some complex APIs
may render this component difficult to understand.

methods.name: _getAmfKey
methods.description: Returns compact model key for given value.

return.desc:
Compact model property name or the same value if
value not found in the context.

methods.name: _ensureAmfModel
methods.description: Ensures that the model is AMF object.

methods.name: _ensureArray
methods.description:
Ensures that the value is an array.
It returns undefined when there's no value.
It returns the same array if the value is already an array.
It returns new array of the item is not an array.

methods.name: _getValue
methods.description: Gets a signle scalar value from a model.

params.name: model
params.description: Amf model to extract the value from.

params.name: key
params.description: Model key to search for the value

methods.name: _getValueArray
methods.description: Gets values from a model as an array of `@value` properties.

params.name: model
params.description: Amf model to extract the value from.

params.name: key
params.description: Model key to search for the value

methods.name: _hasType
methods.description: Checks if a model has a type.

return.desc: True if model has a type.

methods.name: _hasProperty
methods.description: Checks if a shape has a property.

methods.name: _computePropertyArray
methods.description: Computes array value of a property in a model (shape).

methods.name: _computePropertyObject
methods.description:
Computes a value of a property in a model (shape).
It takes first value of a property, if exists.

methods.name: _computeHasStringValue
methods.description: Tests if a passed argumet exists.

methods.name: _computeHasArrayValue
methods.description:
Computes if passed argument is an array and has a value.
It does not check for type or value of the array items.

methods.name: _computeDescription
methods.description: Computes description for a shape.

methods.name: _computeServerVariables
methods.description: Computes value for `serverVariables` property.

methods.name: _computeEndpointVariables
methods.description: Computes value for `endpointVariables` property.

methods.name: _computePayload
methods.description: Computes value for the `payload` property

methods.name: _computeReturns
methods.description: Computes value for `returns` property

methods.name: _computeSecurity
methods.description: Computes value for `security` property

methods.name: _computeHasCustomProperties
methods.description: Computes value for `hasCustomProperties` property.

methods.name: _computeApiVersion
methods.description: Computes API version from the AMF model.

methods.name: _computeEncodes
methods.description: Computes model's `encodes` property.

methods.name: _computeDeclares
methods.description: Computes list of declarations in the AMF api model.

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeReferences
methods.description: Computes list of references in the AMF api model.

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeWebApi
methods.description: Computes AMF's `http://schema.org/WebAPI` model

params.name: model
params.description: AMF json/ld model for an API

methods.name: _computeServer
methods.description: Computes value for `server` property that is later used with other computations.

methods.name: _computeEndpointUri
methods.description: Computes endpoint's URI based on `amfModel` and `endpoint` models.

methods.name: _getBaseUri
methods.description:
Computes base URI value from either `baseUri`, `iron-meta` with
`ApiBaseUri` key or `amfModel` value (in this order).

return.desc: Base uri value. Can be empty string.

methods.name: _getAmfBaseUri
methods.description: Computes base URI from AMF model.

params.name: protocols
params.description:
Listy of supporte dprotocols. If not
provided and required to compute the url it uses `amfModel` to compute
protocols

methods.name: _ensureUrlScheme
methods.description:
A function that makes sure that the URL has a scheme definition.
If no supported protocols information is available it assumes `http`.

params.name: protocols
params.description:
List of supported by the API protocols
An array of string like: `['HTTP', 'HTTPS']`. It lowercase the value.
If not set it tries to read supported protocols value from `amfModel`
property.

methods.name: _computeProtocols
methods.description: Computes supported protocols by the API.

methods.name: _computeExpects
methods.description: Computes value for the `expects` property.

methods.name: _computePropertyValue
methods.description:
Tries to find an example value (whether it's default value or from an
example) to put it into snippet's values.

methods.name: _computeEndpoints
methods.description: Computes list of endpoints from a WebApi model.

return.desc: Always returns an array of endpoints.

methods.name: _computeEndpointModel
methods.description: Computes model for an endpoint documentation.

methods.name: _computeEndpointByPath
methods.description: Computes model for an endpoint documentation using it's path.

methods.name: _computeMethodModel
methods.description: Computes method for the method documentation.

methods.name: _computeOperations
methods.description: Computes list of operations in an endpoint

methods.name: _computeMethodEndpoint
methods.description: Computes an endpoint for a method.

methods.name: __computeMethodsListForMethod
methods.description:
Computes a list of methods for an endpoint that contains a method with
given id.

return.desc: A list of sibling methods or undefined.

methods.name: _computeType
methods.description: Computes a type documentation model.

methods.name: _computeReferenceType
methods.description: Computes a type model from a reference (library for example).

params.name: reference
params.description: AMF model for a reference to extract the data from

return.desc: Type definition or undefined if not found.

methods.name: _computeSecurityModel
methods.description: Computes model for selected security definition.

methods.name: _computeDocument
methods.description: Computes a documentation model.

methods.name: _resolve
methods.description: Resolves a reference to an external fragment.

methods.name: _getExampleValue
methods.description: Gets string value for an example data model.

params.name: isJson
params.description:
If set it checks if the `raw` value is valid JSON.
If it isn't then it parses structured value.

methods.name: _computeExampleFromStructuredValue
methods.description: Computes an example from example structured value.

return.desc: Javascript object or array with structured value.

methods.name: _computeStructuredExampleValue
methods.description: Computes value with propert data type for a structured example.

methods.name: connectedCallback
methods.description:
Ensures aria role atribute is in place.
Attaches element's listeners.

methods.name: _amfChanged
methods.description: Called by the Polymer change observer when `amfModel` property change.

methods.name: _collectData
methods.description:
Collects the information about the API and creates data model
for the navigation element

return.desc:
Data model for the API navigation:
- documentation `Array` - List of documentation data models:
 - id `String` - Node `@id`
 - label `String` - Node label
- types `Array` - List of types data models:
 - id `String` - Node `@id`
 - label `String` - Node label
- securitySchemes `Array` - List of security schemes data models:
 - id `String` - Node `@id`
 - label `String` - Node label
- endpoints `Array` - List of endpoints data models:
 - id `String` - Node `@id`
 - label `String` - Node label
 - methods `Array` - List of methonds data models in an endpoint:
   - id `String` - Node `@id`
   - label `String` - Node label

methods.name: _collectSecurityData
methods.description: Collects the data from the security fragment

methods.name: _collectDocumentationData
methods.description: Collects the data from the documentation fragment

methods.name: _collectTypeData
methods.description: Collects the data from the type fragment

methods.name: _traverseDeclarations
methods.description:
Traverses the `http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#declares`
node to find types and security schemes.

params.name: target
params.description: Target object where to put data.

methods.name: _traverseReferences
methods.description: Traverses the `http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#references`

params.name: target
params.description: Target object where to put data.

methods.name: _traverseEncodes
methods.description:
Traverses the `http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#encodes`
node to find documentation and endpoints.

params.name: target
params.description: Target object where to put data.

methods.name: _appendModelItem
methods.description:
Appends declaration of navigation data model to the target if
it matches documentation or security types.

methods.name: _appendTypeItem
methods.description: Appends "type" item to the results.

methods.name: _appendSecurityItem
methods.description: Appends "security" item to the results.

methods.name: _appendDocumentationItem
methods.description: Appends "documentation" item to the results.

methods.name: _appendEndpointItem
methods.description:
Appends "endpoint" item to the results.
This also iterates over methods to extract method data.

methods.name: _computePathName
methods.description:
Computes label for an endpoint when name is missing and the endpoint
is indented, hence name should be truncated.

params.name: basePaths
params.description: List of base paths already used.

return.desc: Name of the path to render.

methods.name: _createOperationModel
methods.description: Creates the view model for an opration.

methods.name: _toggleSection
methods.description:
Click handler for section name item.
Toggles the view.

methods.name: _selectItem
methods.description: Selectes new item in the menu.

methods.name: _addSelection
methods.description:
Toggles selection state of a node that has `data-api-id` set to
`id`.

methods.name: _clearSelection
methods.description: Removes any current selection that may exist.

methods.name: toggleOperations
methods.description: Toggles endpoint operations list.

methods.name: _selectedChangd
methods.description: Updates the state of selected element when `selected` changes.

methods.name: _labelFilter
methods.description:
Label check agains `query` function called by `dom-repeat` element.
This method uses `__effectiveQuery` property set by `_flushQuery()`
method.

methods.name: _methodFilter
methods.description:
Label and method check agains `query` function called by `dom-repeat`
element. This method uses `__effectiveQuery` property set by
`_flushQuery()` method.

methods.name: _queryChanged
methods.description:
When `query` property change it runs the filter function
in a debouncer set for ~50 ms.

methods.name: _flushQuery
methods.description:
Calles `render()` function on each data repeater that have filterable
items.
It set's `__effectiveQuery` property on the element that is beyond
Polymer's data binding system so it skips 2 function calls each time
it is read. In a repeater filter function that can be a lot.

Also the `__effectiveQuery` is transformed to perform text search.

methods.name: _methodsCountChanged
methods.description:
Hides the parent model when number of children is 0 or shows it
otherwise.

methods.name: _selectionChnaged
methods.description: Dispatches `api-navigation-selection-changed` event on selection change.

methods.name: _itemClickHandler
methods.description:
Navigation item click handler.
It used to be common function for all clicks inside the element
but in tests not all events were handled.

methods.name: _navigationChangeHandler
methods.description:
Handler for `api-navigation-selection-changed`. Updates the selection
if dispatched from other element.

methods.name: _toggleEndpoint
methods.description:
Endpoint label click handler.
Toggles endpoint's methods list.

methods.name: _computeEndpointPadding
methods.description:
Computes `style` attribute value for endpoint item.
It sets padding-left property to indent resources.
See https://github.com/mulesoft/api-console/issues/571.

params.name: factor
params.description: Computed indent factor for the resource

params.name: size
params.description: The size of indentation in pixels.

return.desc: Style attribute value for the item.

methods.name: _computeOperationPaddingLeft
methods.description: Computes operation list item left padding from CSS veriables.

methods.name: _computeEndpointPaddingLeft
methods.description: Computes endpoint list item left padding from CSS veriables.

methods.name: _spaceDownHandler
methods.description:
Cancels space key down event when selecting a method with keyboard.
Without it the page would scroll down.

methods.name: _spaceUpHandler
methods.description: Selectes an item when space up event is detected.

methods.name: _computeRenderSummary
methods.description: Computes value for `_renderSummary` property

methods.name: _computeRenderParth
methods.description: Computes condition value to render path label.

return.desc: True if both arguments are trully.

elements.name: ApiElements.ApiNavigation

attributes.name: amf-model
attributes.description:
Generated AMF json/ld model form the API spec.
The element assumes the object of the first array item to be a
type of `"http://raml.org/vocabularies/document#Document`
on AMF vocabulary.

It is only usefult for the element to resolve references.

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description: A namespace for AMF model

attributes.name: aware
attributes.description: `raml-aware` scope property to use.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
A model `@id` of selected documentation part.
Special case is for `summary` view. It's not part of an API
but most applications has some kins of summary view for the
API.

attributes.name: selected-type
attributes.description:
Type of the selected item.
One of `documentation`, `type`, `security`, `endpoint`, `method`
or `summary`.

This property is set after `selected` property.

attributes.name: summary
attributes.description:
If set it renders `API summary` menu option.
It will allow to set `selected` and `selectedType` to `summary`
when this option is set.

attributes.name: summary-label
attributes.description: A label for the `summary` section.

attributes.name: docs
attributes.description: Computed list of documentatoin items in the API.

attributes.name: has-docs
attributes.description: Computed value, true when `docs` property is set with values

attributes.name: docs-opened
attributes.description: Determines and changes state of documentation panel.

attributes.name: types
attributes.description: Computed list of "type" items in the API.

attributes.name: has-types
attributes.description: Computed value, true when `types` property is set with values

attributes.name: types-opened
attributes.description: Determines and changes state of types panel.

attributes.name: security
attributes.description: Computed list of Security schemes items in the API.

attributes.name: has-security
attributes.description: Computed value, true when `security` property is set with values

attributes.name: security-opened
attributes.description: Determines and changes state of security panel.

attributes.name: endpoints
attributes.description: Computed list of endpoint items in the API.

attributes.name: has-endpoints
attributes.description: Computed value, true when `endpoints` property is set with values

attributes.name: endpoints-opened
attributes.description: Determines and changes state of endpoints panel.

attributes.name: noink
attributes.description: If true, the element will not produce a ripple effect when interacted with via the pointer.

attributes.name: query
attributes.description:
Filters list elements by this value when set.
Clear the value to reset the search.

This is not currently exposed in element's UI due
to complexity of search and performance.

attributes.name: indent-size
attributes.description:
Size of endpoint indentation for nested resources.
In pixels.

attributes.name: allow-paths
attributes.description:
When set it renders full path below endpoint name if the endpoint has
a name (different than the path).
This is not always recommended to use this option as some complex APIs
may render this component difficult to understand.

events.name: api-navigation-selection-changed
events.description:
Dispatched when navigation occurrs.
It ensures that `type` property is always set when selection changes
(selection type changes later than the selection but within the same
microtask).
